text:
We developed an application using Struts-Framework and JSTL-Standard-Tag- Library. Until Tomcat 4.1.12 all works fine. But if I try with Tomcat 4.1.24 (I think also with 4.1.18 on Linux, but I can't check this now) the c:if-tag does not work. The complete body of the tag was not evaluated. One example of code fragment is: ...
There are some other tags nested in c:if i.e. logic:equal and logic:iterate but no further c:if. I work with the Jakarta-implementation of the jstl-core-library in version 1.0.3 Can you help?
creator: hoff@lh2.de

text:
I've had no problems using any JSTL-tags with TC 4.1.x (except for 4.1.19 which 
generated invalid code when nesting tags). Did you verify this is not due other 
tags which do not handle tag-pooling correctly ? Can you provide a simple JSP 
which demonstrates the wrong behaviour ?
creator: yannc76@yahoo.de

text:
I tried to write a small JSP-page with the bug but I had problems to reproduce 
it in this way.
I took another deeper look at it and I think it might has something to do with 
struts. Actually I'm a bit short in time, so I can't test to deep.
But I'm think you're right. It is not just the c:if-tag.

I will try harder in a few weeks.

Until then I will set the bug to invalid.

Thanks for your help so far. Sorry for this.
